news_header: Avian influenza cases have been reported in migratory birds arriving in Finland, raising concerns about the virus's spread among waterfowl and potential risks to poultry and humans.
news_original_title: Muuttolinnut saapuvat – ja se huolestuttaa lintuinfluenssaa seuraavia asiantuntijoita
news_text: There have been multiple reports of avian influenza among migratory birds arriving in Finland this spring, particularly affecting waterfowl. The Food Authority is monitoring the situation with concern, as the H5N1 virus has been prevalent in Central Europe. Although Finland has not seen recent cases, there is a risk of the virus entering the country with migrating birds. Measures are being taken to protect poultry farms, including keeping birds indoors during migration season. Human infections have been reported in other countries, emphasizing the need for vigilance.
